We usually have a great experience with Maharani though every so often we'd come across a day at the buffet where some of the dishes lack the flavor.  What's weird is that we'll come on a day where EVERYTHING is good and then the next time we'll come on a day when maybe half of the dishes are worth raving about.  But we've had enough good experiences where we can forget the 1 or 2 bad days and come here when we're craving Indian.

I've only had takeout. No major complaints. I would order for a reliable hot meal, but so far nothing has blown my mind.

The lamb curry was kind of spicy but besides that not as flavorful as I would prefer. Supposedly comes with yogurt but if it's in the sauce I couldn't tell. Next time will ask for it as a side as well. Generous with the lamb; lots of big, delicious pieces in my dish! Would've liked some more veggies or something to break up the broth in addition to the meat.

Chicken 65 was pretty good and the naan was great but I've never seen a restaurant mess up naan.

Gotta go back for the buffet. It's kind of expensive to do takeout from here so that should be a more affordable way to sample the menu.
I order delivery from here fairly often. It is a bit expensive and it can take a bit of time to arrive. But the food is good and I keep coming back.

Fantastic selection, and our 3 little kids (4 and under) ate well and were taken care of nicely by the staff (high chairs, cups with lids, etc.).  
The only thing that I could complain about was that my husband said it wasn't spicy enough, but he likes it super-duper-hot.  I like it more flavorfully-spicy, if that makes sense.  We've eaten at a lot of Indian restaurants in different areas of the country and in Europe, and this one was excellent.

Very average food...at least for the afternoon buffet! 
I'd much rather go to Maharani on Odana or India Darbar a few blocks away on Odana as well.

One of my favorite lunches in madison! Great variety of Indian food for all you can eat buffet lunch. Nobody judges me for eating several heaping plates of garlic naan and tandoori chicken, and I like that. Trust me, you will leave full and happily sleepy 100% of the time.

I love Indian food, but not "any" Indian food. 

While the dining room is clean, and the service is decently good, the food is anything but lackluster. I went to a buffet lunch with friends, and was not at all impressed or even pleased with the food. On the buffet menu are lentil ball appetizer that's covered in yogurt sauce (I forgot the name ... shame on me), pilafs, 2/3 different type of curries (lamb meat and vegetable ones), and few other items that I didn't try. There are also desert, too. Some of my friend particularly liked the balls covered in honey sauce (again, I forgot the name of the dish, but that's what it is).   I'm not saying that the food is bad, it's OK, but not much more. My two Indian friends also share the same review - they told me to go somewhere else for more authentic food.
Lunch is best time to go - lunch buffet is amazing and a good value.
Went in on a weeknight. Food was okay. Wouldn't go back because food wasn't that great and experience was ordinary.

The Maharani Restaurant is comparable to its sister restaurant on Odana, except the ambiance is a little nicer at this location. I did notice that the service was a little spottier here though - neither as quick nor as thorough as the Odana restaurant. Although the Maharani was nearly empty at 9PM, the servers rarely checked on us. 

Regardless, the food was great. They served the same complimentary flatbread appetizer with the three chutneys, and THEY HAD CHANA MASALA ON THEIR MENU!!! I was so excited. I probably should have ordered it mild though, because medium was a little too spicy for me. Edible, but definitely not as enjoyable as I'm sure it would have been if I'd been able to chew and swallow without blowing smoke out of my ears. 

My friend's samosa chaat wasn't bad either - although neither of us expected it to be a plated dish...or to be so heavily topped with chickpeas. I think we were both expecting regular, fried dumplings filled with a potato/pea mix. 

Still, the perfect place to get your Indian food fix in Madtown. (: MmmMmMmm.

I've been here 3-4 times and as far as Indian buffets go in Madison this one does the job. They tend to have a variety of vegetarian and meat items and the sassiest/spiciest onion chutney I have found in Dane County. 

I prefer India Darbar, but when I don't want to leave the confines of downtown this is my first choice.

Good Indian food. I was taken by the variety in the desserts and the food selection in the buffet. The nan was great, and the veg biryani was fabulous. I couldn't get enough of the gajar halwa either! Definitely one of the to-go places near campus for Indian food.

At the suggestion of my dining companion, we tried out the lunch buffet. It was a holiday and full of people who also didn't want to cook!  It was the tail end of service so feel free to take my review with a grain of salt so to speak. There were a good number of choices for rice and main dishes and several cold options, including salad. The goat dish was mostly bones though and the mint chutney was a bit off somehow. We were served one basket of naan with the buffet and the water was frequently replenished. The desserts were just about gone by the time we indulged but there were several choices and the mango ice cream hit the spot!  It was a good way to try a number of their dishes and I would probably order there again but probably not do the buffet.

Definitely one of the better Indian restaurants, I've been to. Wider choices and good setting. The place has a good ambiance too. A good bet for anyone new to Indian cuisine and would like to try it. Close to the lake, the Capitol, Downtown and the Univ. of Wisconsin. I for one, will go back again, possibly regularly.

This restaurant was much better than some of these reviews would lead you to believe. Amazingly rich flavors. The aloo tikki chat appetizer was the perfect start. We also had Chicken Tikka Masala was just right and the Sag Paneer was spot on. The best thing we had was the Vegetable Mango: I'm not vegetarian but I would never need to eat meat again if this was what I was offered to eat all the time. 
   We came for dinner so I can't review the buffet. Try this restaurant!

Maharani is definitely the best place for Indian food in Madison. As a guy that normally just appreciates a good burger, Indian food was never my thing. Until this place, that is. Maharani has more than a few SUPERB dishes, including chicken biriyani, their many curries, mano ice cream or lassi, and quite a few more. 

I would suggest for anyone looking for something a little different in Madison. There's something here for everyone, but be careful what you wish for with these dishes, mild is hot and hot takes you to hell and back. Delicious food and terrific service.

I am a regular at Maharani. Not only have I lived across the street for the last 3 years, I am a huge fan of Indian food. The buffet is a particular treat - pricey on the weekends especially, but well worth it for the lovely variety of rices, gravy dishes, and appetizers. 

The only downfall of Maharani is their service. Not terribly unusual or awful, but a couple times I had to go and find my waiter to get my glass of water refilled. Mostly they are relatively attentive, and I will keep going back because the food is WELL worth it.

Food
Kadai chicken was not fully cooked
The lentil served was in small quantity
Host and servers were good

Hard to find parking
Food was really good but with takeout you ha e to pay attention to the details. I did not get any sauces!! I requested extra mint chutney and got nothing!!

I've eaten at Maharani both for their lunch buffet and for dinner.

When it comes to their lunch buffet where Maharani truly excels is selection. They have the widest selection available in the Madison area which allows you to try more things -- half the point of a lunch buffet, in my opinion.

The lunch buffet has had consistently good quality food for the several times I've been there. They also do have some spicy dishes for those who are concerned about the lack of authenticity in the heat at most Indian buffets and fortunately by having more dishes available they keep service accessible to most people.

Lunch can get very crowded and that can impact water and naan basket refills.

Similarly dinner is great but can get expensive (especially if you are a naan fiend). The caliber of service increases dramatically when the lunch rush isn't on and our waiter was very attentive and helpful.

If you are looking to try as many new things as you can for lunch this is a great place to go!

The worst restaurant service I've had in my life. The waiters are actively hostile, the way hardened French waiters can be, without the charm of being in Paris. The food wasn't very good, at that. Zero percent tip. Two people on a not-very-busy night, and it took as long as a James Cameron movie. Ugh.

I didn't change my number of stars, but I had to update an experience: Maharani just hosted my birthday party and it went swimmingly. They gave us their back room, which was so warm and inviting for my guests. Everyone's order was right and they served our drinks, appetizers, and entrees at the perfect time. And on top of that, the head waitress (she is always there, kicking ass) saved the day when we forgot birthday candles by just happening to have some behind the counter! Afterwards, everyone came up to tell me how full and happy they were. It was the perfect night. Thank you!

Maharani is one of our fav. Place to eat on weekends, food quality and selections, price, cleanliness is a 5. Love the mango ice cream.! Some weekends I noticed that some dishes are overly salty. Please cut down on the salt. Or just have the salt and pepper available on the table. Thank you.

Lunch buffet, $12.95 (no drink). Water refills were frequent, but other than that service was terrible. We came in, waited. Finally, a man approached. He did not speak a word. He showed us to a table, and walked away. after waiting a few minutes we decided no one was coming back and headed for the buffet.  The restaurant itself is in need of a scrub down and a spruce up. 

The buffet itself was mostly mediocre. Several items I tried were pretty bad. The fried items were soggy. Most dishes were tasteless, and there was not much selection for a vegetarian.

BUT there was one dish that was out of this world good. Mater Paneer, or green peas and paneer.  I am almost crying thinking about it (NO JOKE). It was awesome. One of the best things I've ever eaten. I could eat this dish for EVERY MEAL EVERY DAY fFOR THE REST OF MY LIFE. Yeah, it needed all caps it was that good. Had it not been for this dish, which was a 5, I would have given this place only 1 star.

This restaurant went from being 5 stars to 4 to 3. The food was fantastic. We placed our orders for rasam, chicken vindaloo and rice. After we placed or orders, we got complimentary papadum, which was good. It took quite a long time to get the rasam, but when we got the it, it reminded me exactly of how my family makes it back home. I enjoyed every bite of it, and wanted more after I was done. Then we waited a very long time for our entree, but of course when we got it, we enjoyed it very much. It was pretty spicy, and because of the lack of attention our table got, we didn't get any refills of water after the first one, and we were struggling with the heat of the food. When we finished our food, it took 20 minutes to get the attention of someone to give us our check. Finally, a woman who was not our server saw us looking around and came to help us. I ordered a mango lassi to go, and she came back with that and the check soon after. The mango lassi was super good! It took another 10 minutes to get our server to pick up the check from us... He passed our table multiple times but didn't even look at us. I finally stopped him when he passed us to ask if we pay up front, and it was only then where he took the check from me. Overall, the food was great but the service was bad. It seemed like it was only our server that wasn't attentive, the others looked a little better. I would definitely just order take out from here so I can get good food without the slow service.

Great lunch Buffet! To be transparent I only eat Indian food that have buffets. This is one of the better ones. Food is fresh and plentiful, huge variety. If you're in the mood to over eat or can't decide what you want then come here.
Great tikka masala.  Garlic naan wasn't bad.  I was happy/satisfied!

This was my first time here.
We went with friends for the lunch Buffet and it was pretty delicious. The price wasn't too bad with how much food there was.
I really liked the "buttered chicken" which I had 2 helpings of. And the naan was great. 
Also the tandoori chicken was very moist and a great  selection of other Indian dishes that I don't know how to pronounce. 

It was nice to see that it was wheelchair accessible. 
The only small complaint that I had was that they didn't come around and refill our drinks and they completely forgot one of soda's. 
It was a little difficult to get someone's attention, but nothing that would keep me from going back. 

I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good Indian Buffet  for s great price
gotta come here for lunch!!! and they also served the naan bread fresh!!!

So far my favorite Madison Indian restaurant.  Everything's always been fresh and tasty, and there are SO many choices!  The staff is friendly but a tad slow, but nothing to be annoyed with at all.  My first recommendation if someone asks for a good Indian buffet or sit down dinner!

Avoid at all costs - found chewed up bubblegum in the food

We found chewed up bubblegum in our food during lunch buffet.  What is worse is that the manager refused to throw out the dish from the buffet and replace the contents.  People, this is a bad sign since they are willing to cut corners and worse to save a few bucks.  
Anyways why would they spit out gum into the food?  This is so gross!  I will not go there again since I am sure that they really don't give a damn about their customer's health and would rather have us get sick than waste a couple of bucks.

I've been to Maharani quite a few times since being here in Madison. I enjoy it a lot!

When I used to work downtown, the lunch buffet was a thing that I'd go to. Totally worth it if you're looking to try a bunch of things and not looking to spend too much money.

For dinner, I think I've always gotten the Chicken Tikka Masala. I have never been let down by it. They offer three levels of spiciness - mild, medium, and hot. The server didn't seem to understand my request for somewhere between mild and medium. Medium is too spicy for me but mild is not enough!
I am so happy Maharani has started delivery in Fitchburg. It's going to be my go to henceforth! #win

I love this place because the staff is awesome and the lunch buffet is all you can eat for like 10 bucks. I highly recommend the Chicken Masala, Mango Ice cream, and the coconut tomato soup, if they have it. I wouldn't recommend it for the rest of their hours because why pay more to eat a little later? 
The outdoor seating is also very nice, weather permitting!
This place is a staple in my list of places to take visitors to-  I've had many friends and relatives come visit and I take them there and they have all LOVED it. You will too!

Great food.  Buffet seems bigger than the one at Maharajah.

Problem...... A cockroach ran up the wall behind my wife.   Waiter killed it.  No manager stopped by.  Needless to say we paid for our meal.  We never went back.  A shame too.   We really liked the food!

Lunch buffet is delicious and staff is great. The beef curry is delicious and plethora of sauces and spices make the meal flavorful. Many different types of traditional Indian dishes make the buffet great.

No offense but I have to say a big no-no to this place. I once wrote the review but was filtered by Yelp. But hey, I have to say the truth - at least from my end.
I didn't want to waste my time writing for them. It was a very bad experience. The service was bad and I can find a better place for the taste. 
I actually hate to write a bad review, but well, I have to say what I've to say.
Hubby and I decided not to give it another shot.

This place has never caused so many people to quit on their previous eating plans and divert their path sharply to the front door. Multiple plates are a necessity, so make sure you haven't eaten in about 20 hours.
 #mighthavetostarteatingthebottomofmycoffeecupaftertryingthecaramelcustard

MMMM MM! So yummy! 

I visited Maharani this weekend for brunch on Saturday. It was DELICIOUS! I really enjoy Indian food, but as someone who is not really all that familiar with it yet, buffets are the way to go. I can sample and try things without committing to an entire entree and risk not liking it. 

Maharani had a very decent selection of things to choose from. I was able to find lots of delicious foods to try. 

We were there around noon. The restaurant was pretty busy - most tables were full. We didn't have any wait though, and there was never a rushed feeling like they were trying to get us in and out. They came around often to refill our water glasses. I wish we would have gotten more Naan, but that wasn't a huge issue. The Naan was just SO GOOD. 

Parking can be difficult in this area. There are metered spots on the opposite side of the block that we were able to grab one of. That was nice as we didn't have to cross any streets. 

I will be back for sure!

Average is the best word to describe Maharani's lunch buffet. There salad/chutney bar takes up half of the buffet, and I would have like to have seen more vegetarian options. The food is tasty but I found the breads to be really dry. The staff knows how to get the job done but doesn't go out of their way to be friendly. The atmosphere is comfortable but not creative. If you want an Indian dining experience in Madison that's better than average, I would recommend Taj on Park Street or Maharaja on Odana.
